body:
Yea, this happens because `brew` doesn't clean up all the empty directories left behind at
```
$(brew --prefix)/lib/python3.10/site-packages/mapserver
```
with `brew uninstall mapserver && brew cleanup`. It probably should.
@carlocab it's actually much simpeler. We don't install libraries for the system python. We install for the Homebrew python so this is expected behaviour.

Oh, wait. Never mind. It does. Run
```
brew cleanup
```

@SMillerDev python3 points to python@3.10 installed with `brew install python3`
```
company@Alekseis-MBP ~ % cd /usr/local/bin
company@Alekseis-MBP bin % ls -la | grep "python3"
-rwxrwxrwx    1 company  admin       248 Sep  3  2017 ipython3
lrwxr-xr-x    1 company  admin        42 Aug 15 15:01 python3 -> ../Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.6_1/bin/python3
lrwxr-xr-x    1 company  admin        49 Aug 15 15:01 python3-config -> ../Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.6_1/bin/python3-config
lrwxr-xr-x    1 company  admin        45 Aug 15 15:01 python3.10 -> ../Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.6_1/bin/python3.10
lrwxr-xr-x    1 company  admin        52 Aug 15 15:01 python3.10-config -> ../Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.6_1/bin/python3.10-config
lrwxr-xr-x    1 company  admin        43 Aug 15 13:20 python3.9 -> ../Cellar/python@3.9/3.9.13_3/bin/python3.9
lrwxr-xr-x    1 company  admin        50 Aug 15 13:20 python3.9-config -> ../Cellar/python@3.9/3.9.13_3/bin/python3.9-config
```

> Oh, wait. Never mind. It does. Run
> 
> ```
> brew cleanup
> ```

Sorry, doesn't work for me :(
```
company@Alekseis-MBP ~ % brew install mapserver
==> Downloading https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/mapserver/manifests/7.6.4_8
Already downloaded: /Users/company/Library/Caches/Homebrew/downloads/aade11932c2d3f89d0acdb32687dc9346c8bab82f1628db21b3fb500cdd0598b--mapserver-7.6.4_8.bottle_manifest.json
==> Downloading https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/mapserver/blobs/sha256:375206c0885839f244be547433f983e683d11657c7ca0791
Already downloaded: /Users/company/Library/Caches/Homebrew/downloads/6c78892f1106cd1894781f2280668bb8d704c8da40c582470188106d4e48896e--mapserver--7.6.4_8.catalina.bottle.tar.gz
==> Pouring mapserver--7.6.4_8.catalina.bottle.tar.gz
üç∫  /usr/local/Cellar/mapserver/7.6.4_8: 130 files, 8.1MB
==> Running `brew cleanup mapserver`...
Disable this behaviour by setting HOMEBREW_NO_INSTALL_CLEANUP.
Hide these hints with HOMEBREW_NO_ENV_HINTS (see `man brew`).
company@Alekseis-MBP ~ % brew uninstall mapserver
Uninstalling /usr/local/Cellar/mapserver/7.6.4_8... (130 files, 8.1MB)
company@Alekseis-MBP ~ % brew cleanup
company@Alekseis-MBP ~ % python3
Python 3.10.6 (main, Aug 11 2022, 13:47:18) [Clang 12.0.0 (clang-1200.0.32.29)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import mapscript
>>> dir(mapscript)
['__doc__', '__file__', '__loader__', '__name__', '__package__', '__path__', '__spec__']
>>>
```

Hmmm, yea, that was mistaken. It _should_ be fixed by `brew cleanup` at least, though, even if not `brew uninstall`.

I think `brew cleanup` isn't removing these directories because of all the `*.pyc` files that live in a `__pycache__` subdirectory that are created by Python. We should probably be safe to delete a subdirectory of `site-packages` if all it contains are directories and `*.pyc` files.

@carlocab deleting subdirectory of `site-packages` definitely fixes the problem, but that is not very neat solution. This problem persists for many packages, like `tbb` or `lit`, but at the same time `six` and `libpython-tabulate` work fine with the similar installation method.

> deleting subdirectory of `site-packages` definitely fixes the problem, but that is not very neat solution.

It may not be very neat, but there is no other solution:
```
‚ùØ mkdir -p "$(brew --prefix)/lib/python3.10/site-packages/foo"
‚ùØ python3 -c 'import foo'; echo $?
0
‚ùØ rm -r "$(brew --prefix)/lib/python3.10/site-packages/foo"
‚ùØ python3 -c 'import foo'; echo $?
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'foo'
1
```

All we need to do is make sure `brew cleanup` handles this automatically, as I suggested in https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/13701#issuecomment-1215221767. 

> This problem persists for many packages, like `tbb` or `lit`, but at the same time `six` and `libpython-tabulate` work fine with the similar installation method.

That's because `tbb` and `lit` leave behind essentially empty directory trees in `site-packages`, while `six` and `libpython-tabulate` do not.
@carlocab thank you a lot! Where can I push initiative with `brew cleanup` automatically handling this?

You can try to have a look at the code in [`cleanup.rb`](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/5047d4249e938d448ce8c80641beb4d42e90dbad/Library/Homebrew/cleanup.rb) yourself to try to fix this. Otherwise, we can wait and see if someone can find the time to have a look.

The right place is probably somewhere here:

https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/5047d4249e938d448ce8c80641beb4d42e90dbad/Library/Homebrew/cleanup.rb#L492-L534
